_header: Jesu king of heaven and hell / Man and woman I will thee tell
Note: For the B and C Texts see 6650 and 1913.
Subjects: charters, of Christ; devotional treatises; instruction, religious
_description: The ‘Long Charter’ of Christ (A Text) — 234 lines in couplets

Bod89.First Lines:
Ihesu crist of heuene and helleMan and womman I wolle ȝow
                    telle…
Bod89.Last Lines:
…To þat blis þat lost oure forme frendeCrist vs
                    bryng wiþ oute ende
Bod89.Attributed Title:
Hic incipit carta cristi (f. 45); Explicit carta cristi (f.
                    49)
Bod89.Editions:
Spalding,  Mary Caroline. 
             The Middle English Charters of Christ.
         Bryn Mawr, PA: Bryn Mawr College, 1914: 18-44.

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
Ihesu kyng of heuen and helleMon and Wommon I wol þe
                    telle…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Þe blisse þat loste oure frendeto þe whuche
                    blisce crist us bringe with outen endeA. M. E. N. Amen.
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.
BodEngPoeta1.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl. 
             “Nachträge zu den Legenden 5: The Messengers of Death.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         79 (1887): 411-70: 424.
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             The Minor Poems of the Vernon Manuscript, Part 2.
EETS
         o.s. 117 (1901; repr. 1973): 637-57.

BodRawPoe175.First Lines:
Ihesu kyng of heuen & hellMan & woman I will þe
                    tell…
BodRawPoe175.Last Lines:
…þe blys þat lost our forme frendeTo þe whilk
                    crist vs bring with outen ende
BodRawPoe175.Editions:
Spalding,  Mary Caroline. 
             The Middle English Charters of Christ.
         Bryn Mawr, PA: Bryn Mawr College, 1914: 18-44.

BodAddC280.First Lines:
Ihesu kyng of heuene & helleMan & woman I ȝow
                    telleWhat loue I haue do for þeLoke what þu hauyst do for
                    me…
BodAddC280.Last Lines:
…þat is to seyn þe blysse of heuynAmen for is nams
                    seuyn
BodAddC280.Note:
212 lines in this witness; ‘nams’ in last line is written
                    over erasure; at the end: ‘Explicit carta domini nostri Ihesu
                    Christi’.
BodAddC280.Editions:
Spalding,  Mary Caroline. 
             The Middle English Charters of Christ.
         Bryn Mawr, PA: Bryn Mawr College, 1914: 18-44.

OxfMagdStPet.First Lines:
Ihesu kyng of heuen ant helleman & woman y wil þe
                    telle…
OxfMagdStPet.Last Lines:
…þis y made for mankynde my loue dedys to haue in
                    mynde
OxfMagdStPet.Note:
The document is one leaf, with the poem written at the back; it looks
                    complete, 62 lines, couplets. At the end: hoc facite in meam
                    comemoracoun.
OxfMagdStPet.Editions:
Spalding,  Mary Caroline. 
             The Middle English Charters of Christ.
         Bryn Mawr, PA: Bryn Mawr College, 1914: 18-44.

BLHar2346.First Lines: Ihesu kyng of heuene & helleMan & womman y wol ȝow telle…
BLHar2346.Last Lines: …þe blysse þat lost oure forme frendeCrist vs graunt with oute ende
BLHar2346.Editions:
Spalding,  Mary Caroline. 
             The Middle English Charters of Christ.
         Bryn Mawr, PA: Bryn Mawr College, 1914: 18-44.

BLHar5396.First Lines: Ihesu cryst of heuyn & hellemen & wemen I wyl ȝou telle…
BLHar5396.Last Lines: …þe blysse þat lastyth euyr to my frendeCryste us brynge with owtyn ende
BLHar5396.Attributed Title: What Chryst hath done for us (added to upper margin by a later hand, f. 301)
BLHar5396.Editions:
Spalding,  Mary Caroline. 
             The Middle English Charters of Christ.
         Bryn Mawr, PA: Bryn Mawr College, 1914: 18-44.

BLAdd11307.First Lines:
Jhesu kyng of heuene and helleMan and womman I wole þe
                    telle…
BLAdd11307.Last Lines:
…The blisse þat loste oure forme frendeCrist vs sende
                    wiþouten ende. Amen
BLAdd11307.Note:
Facing transcription of each folio by a nineteenth-century writer,
                    Joseph Haslewood (see f. 5).
BLAdd11307.Attributed Title:
Acts of Our Saviour (Written in the First Person) (title page, f. 1,
                    nineteenth-century hand)
BLAdd11307.Editions:
Spalding,  Mary Caroline. 
             The Middle English Charters of Christ.
         Bryn Mawr, PA: Bryn Mawr College, 1914: 18-44.
